Name: Raising the fine for commercial vehicles that park on residential streets overnight.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to raising the fine for commercial vehicles that park on residential streets overnight.

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Transportation
This Introduction was Sine Die (Filed, End of Session)

Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:

	Section 1.  Subdivision c of section 19-170 of chapter 5 of title 19 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended to read as follows:
	c.  A first violation of this section shall be punishable by [the] a monetary fine [authorized for violation of the rules and regulations of the commissioner in paragraph one of subdivision a of section twenty nine hundred and three of the New York City Charter] of seven hundred fifty dollars.  Any subsequent violation of this section by the same person within a six-month period shall be punishable by a monetary fine of one thousand two hundred fifty dollars.
Â§2.  This local law shall take effect sixty days after it is enacted into law.
PH
LS # 2559
3/9/07 - noon
